STATIONARY SOURCE

The Altoona Pennsylvania site stores, handles, and delivers a variety of hazardous and non-hazardous chemical products to wholesale customers in Pennsylvania, West Virginia, New York, and Maryland. The facility handles Chlorine and Sulfur Dioxide at inventory levels above the threshold planning quantity. 

GENERAL PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

As outlined previously, Univar Solutions USA is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and utilizes this program to meet the prevention program requirements under RMP.

Chemical-specific prevention steps include the following:
1. The maintenance of minimal practical inventories.
2. Employee training and operating procedures.
3. Employee release detection and mitigation activities.
4. Equipment and containers designed to meet appropriate regulatory guidelines. 

ACCIDENT HISTORY

The site has experienced no accidents as specified in 40 CFR Part 68 related to the handling of chlorine or sulfur dioxide in the previous 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

An emergency contingency plan has been prepared and made available to local emergency response agencies. Blair County Emergency Planning Committee is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated and verified.  Agreements have been formalized with emergency response contractors to provide on site and off site emergency response services in the event of a release.

RMP PLAN

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Univar Solutions USA LLC is a wholesale chemical distributor serving a wide variety of U.S. industries.  Founded in 1924, Univar Solutions USA LLC supplies the food industry, chemical compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest products, oil and gas producers, electronics, coatings and many other key industries with the chemical raw materials required to produce or refine products utilized in numerous end-use markets.

Univar Solutions USA Inc. is a member of the National Association of Chemical distributors (NACD) and complies with the Responsible Distribution Process (RDP), an environmental, health, and safety improvement initiative.

Some of the products stored and handled by Univar Solutions USA are subject to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40 CFR Part 68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation and submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein.  The contents of the RMP Plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive Summary.

CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH

1. Prevention Program

Processes that are subject to OSHA's Process Safety management (PSM) standard AND are regulated under EPA's RMP rule are subject to the Program 3 Prevention program.  Univar Solutions USA has documented the Prevention Program in its Process Safety Management Manual.  Briefly, this program includes provisions and requirements for:

* Process Safety Information
* Process Hazard Analysis
* Operating Procedures
* Training
* Mechanical Integrity
* Management of Change
* Pre-Startup Review
* Compliance Audits
* Incident Investigation
* Employee Participation
* Hot Work permits
* Contractors
